author: .vbuterin
content: yeah logs are definitely thoroughly outdated at this point. Logs not quite efficient enough to have the UX that people need -> dapps use thegraph or other higher-layer solutions -> those solutions can also cover every call or anything else that is not a log

author: .vbuterin
content: But they are super standardized at this point, so keeping the opcode around and cutting its gas cost soon seems reasonable

author: .vbuterin
content: basically, the long-term idea is that you create your own scheme that generates "events" while processing a block, and you keep generating roots of all events, and making ZK-SNARKs to prove those roots as new blocks appear, and then whenever a user wants a proof of an event you give them a merkle branch of that

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm less sure about this.  The Graph originally tried to, and failed, so we have at least that information to suggest it is *really hard*.

author: sky.cactus
content: This feels similar to L2s at this point, where with some hand waving one can build a permissionless L2 in theory, but it has been years now and we still have a grand total of 0 permissionless L2s.  Similarly suggesting that at the very least this is a *really hard* problem, if not impossible.

author: sky.cactus
content: For L2s I think it is possible, but really hard.  For something like events, it may be not realistically possible (I haven't thought about it as much, so my confidence is low).

author: 0x1984
content: just to the permissionless L2 point, restaking might just get this job done, as a subset of validators enlist higher spec hardware to do extra job. The same can be applied to events. Of course it does not carry the full security guarantee of ETH, but most tasks do not need that level and just like a natural sharding

author: sky.cactus
content: If it doesn't "inherit the security properties of ETH" then it isn't a rollup L2 as originally defined.  I agree that there are useful tasks that don't need to be permissionless, but it that really what we are trying to build?  Permissioned/trusted/censorable software?

author: 0x1984
content: currently L2 does "inherit the security" as the block is in ETH, just the path to it is weak. Still the path to it has to be as strong as ETH, maybe. If restaking is using a portion of validators to secure that path(rollup queue) it's still permissionless, just with weaker safety in $. Same argument might can be made for events
